statements: SELECT * FROM car_design_team;
SELECT employee_name, role FROM car_design_team;
SELECT * FROM car_design_team WHERE role='Designer';
SELECT employee_name, project_assignment FROM car_design_team WHERE project_assignment='SUV';
SELECT * FROM car_design_team ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM car_design_team WHERE role = 'Designer';
SELECT employee_name, role FROM car_design_team WHERE project_assignment = 'Car Model 1' ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT COUNT(employee_id) AS total_designers FROM car_design_team WHERE role = 'Designer';
SELECT employee_name, role, project_assignment FROM car_design_team WHERE role = 'Engineer' AND project_assignment IN ('Car Model 2', 'Car Model 3');
SELECT DISTINCT project_assignment FROM car_design_team ORDER BY project_assignment ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT employee_id, name FROM employees WHERE project_assignment = 'Project X';
SELECT * FROM projects ORDER BY project_name ASC;
SELECT project_name, COUNT(*) AS team_size FROM projects GROUP BY project_name;
SELECT name, role FROM employees WHERE role='Manager';
SELECT employee_id, name, role FROM employees WHERE role='Developer' ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT project_name, team_lead_id FROM projects WHERE project_id IN (1, 3, 5);
SELECT * FROM employees JOIN projects ON employees.employee_id = projects.team_lead_id;
SELECT DISTINCT role FROM employees WHERE project_assignment IS NULL ORDER BY role ASC;
SELECT * FROM car_design_teams;
SELECT team_name FROM car_design_teams ORDER BY team_name DESC;
SELECT e.employee_name, e.role, t.team_name FROM employees e JOIN car_design_teams t ON e.team_id = t.team_id;
SELECT p.project_name, e.employee_name FROM projects p JOIN employees e ON p.employee_id = e.employee_id ORDER BY p.project_name ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT team_id FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM car_design_teams;
SELECT team_id, team_name FROM car_design_teams ORDER BY team_id DESC;
SELECT project_name, project_id FROM projects WHERE project_id < 10;
SELECT employee_name, role FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager';
SELECT * FROM employees JOIN projects ON employees.employee_id = projects.employee_id ORDER BY employee_name ASC, project_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, role FROM employees;
SELECT team_id, COUNT(employee_id) AS num_employees FROM employees GROUP BY team_id;
SELECT * FROM teams WHERE team_lead IS NOT NULL;
SELECT project_name, start_date, end_date FROM projects ORDER BY start_date DESC;
SELECT employee_id, name, role FROM employees WHERE team_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM teams WHERE team_lead = 1002;
SELECT project_name, start_date, end_date FROM projects WHERE start_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT team_name, team_lead, project_name FROM teams JOIN projects ON teams.project_id = projects.project_id;
SELECT employee_id, name, role_name FROM employees JOIN roles ON employees.role = roles.role_name;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, role_id FROM employees WHERE role_id = 1;
SELECT project_name, project_manager FROM projects WHERE project_manager = 100;

SELECT employee_name, role_name, project_name FROM employees JOIN roles ON employees.role_id = roles.role_id JOIN team_assignments ON employees.employee_id = team_assignments.employee_id JOIN projects ON team_assignments.project_id = projects.project_id;
SELECT employee_name AS Name, assignment_id AS AssignmentID FROM employees JOIN team_assignments ON employees.employee_id = team_assignments.employee_id;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE role_id = 1 ORDER BY employee_name ASC
SELECT employee_name, role_name FROM employees INNER JOIN roles ON employees.role_id = roles.role_id WHERE roles.role_name = 'Manager'
SELECT project_name, employee_name FROM projects INNER JOIN employees ON projects.project_manager = employees.employee_id ORDER BY project_name DESC
SELECT employee_name, privilege_name FROM employees INNER JOIN roles ON employees.role_id = roles.role_id INNER JOIN privileges ON roles.role_id = privileges.role_id WHERE employees.employee_id = 1

SELECT employee_name, COUNT(project_id) AS project_count FROM team_assignments INNER JOIN employees ON team_assignments.employee_id = employees.employee_id GROUP BY employee_name HAVING COUNT(project_id) > 1
